title: Momina Duraid
text:
Momina Duraid () is a <a href="Pakistani">Pakistani</a> director and producer. She is a senior producer and creative head of television network <a href="Hum%20TV">Hum TV</a> and CEO of her own production company <a href="MD%20Productions">MD Productions</a>. She has produced and created several series including "<a href="Dastaan%20%282010%20TV%20series%29">Dastaan</a>" (2010), "<a href="Qaid-e-Tanhai">Qaid-e-Tanhai</a>" (2010–11), "<a href="Humsafar">Humsafar</a>" (2011–12), "<a href="Shehr-e-Zaat">Shehr-e-Zaat</a>" (2012), "<a href="Zindagi%20Gulzar%20Hai">Zindagi Gulzar Hai</a>" (2012–13), "<a href="Diyar-e-Dil">Diyar-e-Dil</a>" (2015), "<a href="Sadqay%20Tumhare">Sadqay Tumhare</a>" (2015), "<a href="Mann%20Mayal">Mann Mayal</a>" (2016), "<a href="Udaari">Udaari</a>" (2016), "<a href="Bin%20Roye%20%28TV%20series%29">Bin Roye</a>" (2016), "<a href="Yaqeen%20Ka%20Safar">Yaqeen Ka Safar</a>" (2017), "<a href="Suno%20Chanda">Suno Chanda</a>" (2018) and "<a href="Ehd-e-Wafa">Ehd-e-Wafa</a>" (2019).
In 2015, Momina ventured into film direction and co-directed "<a href="Bin%20Roye">Bin Roye</a>". Later that same year, she founded film production house, <a href="Hum%20Films">Hum Films</a>. She is married to Duraid Qureshi and is a daughter-in-law of <a href="Hum%20Network">Hum Network</a> president and founder, <a href="Sultana%20Siddiqui">Sultana Siddiqui</a>. In 2015, she was named among the <a href="Pond%27s">Pond's</a> list of "Miracle Journey: The 100 Most Inspirational Women".
Career.
Before entering into media, Momina was working as a marketing executive at bank, she said, "Media was the last thing I thought I would do. My mother-in-law, <a href="Sultana%20Siddiqui">Sultana Siddiqui</a> has been definitely associated with the industry as she worked for PTV but at the beginning, I was only looking after finances. I didn’t know that I would be stepping into the creative side of things." She produced <a href="Samira%20Fazal">Samira Fazal</a>'s "Mere Paas Paas" as her first independent drama series, that earned her critical acclaim. In 2010 she produced <a href="Partition%20of%20India">partition</a> based drama series "<a href="Dastaan%20%282010%20TV%20series%29">Dastaan</a>" based on the novel "<a href="Bano%20%28novel%29">Bano</a>" by <a href="Razia%20Butt">Razia Butt</a>, the series starred then newcomer <a href="Fawad%20Khan">Fawad Khan</a> with <a href="Sanam%20Baloch">Sanam Baloch</a> playing the title character of Bano. "Dastaan" received extravagant reception from critics and became one of the most acclaimed series of all time. At <a href="1st%20Hum%20Awards">1st Hum Awards</a> ceremony serial was awarded <a href="Hum%20Honorary%20Most%20Challenging%20Subject%20Award">Hum Honorary Most Challenging Subject Award</a>, and received five nominations at <a href="10th%20Lux%20Style%20Awards">10th Lux Style Awards</a>, winning Best Director for <a href="Haissam%20Hussain">Haissam Hussain</a> Momina then produced number of series and founded her own production company <a href="Momina%20Duraid%20Productions">Momina Duraid Productions</a> and became the senior producer of <a href="Hum%20TV">Hum TV</a>.
In 2011, Momina convinced <a href="Farhat%20Ishtiaq">Farhat Ishtiaq</a> to dramatize her novel "<a href="Humsafar%20%28novel%29">Humsafar</a>" into a <a href="Humsafar">television series</a>, which was previously rejected by two production houses. After its release "Humsafar" gained instant popularity and received the overwhelming response from critics and people all over the world. Critics regarded "Humsafar" as revival of drama industry. Sabahat Zakariya of "Dawn News" wrote, "If <a href="Haseena%20Moin">Haseena Moin</a> was the benchmark of mass popularity back then, then "Humsafar" is an indicator of our endemic regressiveness." The series has a <a href="cult%20following">cult following</a> with huge fan following especially in India, Europe and North America. The series lead actors <a href="Mahira%20Khan">Mahira Khan</a> and <a href="Fawad%20Khan">Fawad Khan</a> went on to become most popular actors in Pakistani film and television industry. <a href="Hum%20TV">Hum TV</a> honored the craft and crew of serial giving them a special <a href="Hum%20Honorary%20Phenomenal%20Serial%20Award">Hum Honorary Phenomenal Serial Award</a>.
In 2015, Momina co-directed her first film "<a href="Bin%20Roye">Bin Roye</a>" under her production house <a href="Hum%20Films">Hum Films</a>, that earned her rave reviews, and became the third <a href="List%20of%20highest-grossing%20Pakistani%20films">highest-grossing Pakistani film</a> of all time. After the release of "Bin Roye", Hum Films has distributed and produced over fifteen films both domestically and internationally.
In 2016, seven of ten-scheduled drama series that Momina produced including, "<a href="Dastaan%20%282010%20TV%20series%29">Dastaan</a>" (2010), "<a href="Humsafar">Humsafar</a>" (2011–12), "<a href="Zindagi%20Gulzar%20Hai">Zindagi Gulzar Hai</a>" (2012–13), "<a href="Sadqay%20Tumhare">Sadqay Tumhare</a>" (2015) are set to release on <a href="online%20streaming">online streaming</a> service <a href="Netflix">Netflix</a>.
